review.reviewtitle: I created an account just for this comment

Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you sooooo much for this preservation of a rare DS game. I myself have never seen nor heard any story regarding this piece of history until i stumbled upon you. You are truly a big hearted person, willing to drop THIS much efforts into making this game to stay longer in the game community. In 5 years or more, we'll saw development poured into this game such as deep research and translation (Hey! If you are a rom translator reading this, please translate this gem. review.reviewtitle: A found piece of Mcdonald's history

ONE STEP FOR MCDONALDS GAMING. ANOTHER STEP FOR THOSE WHO WANT TO MAKE THE BURGERS
You are an absolute legend, Nick.
mcdonal

You would need to import the save file (.sav), as that‚Äôs where all personalized data is handled. You can search for your particular emulators ways of doing so, since I was using DeSmuME I chose ‚ÄúImport Backup Memory‚Äù and after selecting the file chose the second option of ‚ÄúAUTO (from imported save data size)‚Äù as the first option wouldn‚Äôt work (since the current save data size is 4Mbit as made clear on the right of the window while the actual save file itself is 512Mbit)

Nick, This is amazing. You had to go through many hassles, But it was worth it in the end. You have managed to preserve a astonishing part of Video Game History. I have nothing but respect for all of the work you have done. I don't know what else to say, I am just lost for words. I'm excited to see what comes next from you. Stay safe, And have a good one! :)

Hi there, When you download the game and use the code from Nick to get in. Go to MGR mode (manager mode) -> crew entry and chose first option. it will ask you for an id , insert : 000000 (or whatever you may remember), Then enter your name (you can change to roman charachter on the left side of the keyboard) then chose your avatar and you will have a default password shown on screen (probably 160700).
Restart the game Choose the second option Enter 000000 (or whatever id you chose) Now enter the default pass you got (160700). Now enter 000000 (or whatever pass you like)
Now if you boot the game. It will be accessible by chosing first option and just insert 0's all the way :)
Congrats McDo employee ! . Remember manager mode will not be available on your own created account (duuh your an employee now) but playing the game will be so much easier and faster now !!

review.reviewtitle: I am playing on my 3ds right now
review.reviewbody:
So all you need to do is have an r4 card and import the files. If you are in the same boat as me and don't have one of those you need to have cfw on you 3ds as well as a piece of software installed called TWLoader++. Using this software you are able to play nds roms directly on your 3ds (or dsi but the process is different). Assuming you already have this software installed on a modified 3ds (or dsi) you now have to import the rom provided into a rom folder on the sd-card of your system, start the software and open the game. Exit the game and turn off the console so that you can eject the sd-card. Go back into the sd-card and back into the rom folder , in the folder along with the rom you imported you will find a saves folder, delete the file in this folder for the McDonalds game and import the provided file.
You are now playing the game on Nintendo hardware.
I've managed to get this running on both my modded 3ds and an emulator on android! this game is surprisingly fun; I love it lol

review.reviewtitle: How you can load the save in DeSmuME!
review.reviewbody: I initially had trouble like everyone else, but I found the solution! 1. Click File->Import Backup Memory 2. Open the save file from the download 3. Under "Choose one of these sizes", select "AUTO (from imported save data size)". It's the second option in mine, the wrong option is selected by default! 4. The game will restart, and you can now access the password screen!

Notes for anyone using a very old R4 card for DS. ie: The kind that only reads 2gb FAT formatted SD cards.
The file names on the VERY old R4 cards want to look like this:
- DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds - DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds.sav
It's a subtle change, but if like me you spent a few minutes wondering, why you couldn't unlock the title, this was it for me.
the game doesn't open on a flashcard

review.reviewtitle: Works well. Slight tweak needed for DraStic to work
review.reviewbody: For those asking how to get things working on DraStic all you need to do is copy the .sav file to /storage/emulated/0/DraStic/backup and rename the .sav part to .dsv. this will get you up and running no problem. Hope that helps.
Yet another great piece of history archived.

Just wanted to say thank you; I was surprised to see there was another game (well, sort of) by McDonalds. It seems this one is more difficult to come by (than the GB game Mcdonald's Monogatari (2001) which I happily own; it was quite difficult to find a copy of it!) so I am very happy to be able to play it. I followed the instructions by Pacca64 since I too had to change it to "auto" under the "import backup memory" tab to make it work. Love it very much and thanks again! (and to the commenters for helping in choosing an emulator and accessing the game).

review.reviewtitle: If You Want To Play On iOS Follow These Steps
review.reviewbody: First you need delta (Emulator) you need a computer so you can sideload delta download altstore (Search it up on youtube) when you do that sideload delta then find a provenance ipa 1.5 beta to be specific when you get that open it then press local cloud servers press the green plus add the ecdp rom and then share it then press open in delta open it rename the game if you want to now rename the sav to dsv and put it in your games folder and rename your dsv to whatever your games name is for example mines 136 and random letters find your games name rename the dsv to that put the dsv in the games folder and you can play

review.reviewtitle: No one reads this message EVER, they just go on with their life and say they need help.
review.reviewbody:
If your one of those people, PLEASE READ!!!
Q: How do I download? A: Pretty easy, just go to this link and download both the .nds and .sav file: https://archive.org/download/mcdonalds-japan-ecdp-rom-training-nintendo-ds-cartridge-dump
Q: I'm stuck on the menu, help! A: You see, if your using an emulator like DeSmuME, stop using it. Why you ask? It's because the game needs Internet in order to work. And if your pressing the third button then don't. Press the first one!
Q: Well, how do I get an emulator that supports Internet? A:Get melonDS, link to download is here: http://melonds.kuribo64.net/downloads.php
Q: It says it needs BIOS! A: https://emulation.gametechwiki.com/index.php/Emulator_Files#Nintendo_DS_.2F_DSi (click on the first one and I tested these BIOS, they work. US region)
Q: WHAT DO I DO TO PLAY THE GAME!?!??! A: Load the .sav file first, then the .nds file. Should work.
Q: Can I play this on mob- A: NO. There's a chance you may or may not get this rom working on a DS mobile emulator and I'm not support for DS mobile emulators.
Q: I have a R4i Gold, what do I do? A: You need to rename the .nds file extension to ".nds.sav" (or was it the .sav file? can't remember but try both)
Q: Do I download the torrent? A: No, it's not required to but if you want you can (if you have ¬µTorrent)
Q: Do I have to download the other files? A: Not really, nor are they required.

review.reviewbody: When I load up the everything is perfect but then I can‚Äôt access the 1st menu which log you in

Jesse Jaeger, To run this game on any device you must first download an emulator for the NDS. I'm not good with Nintendo systems so idk if newer-ish consoles such as the 3ds would work with this dump. If so then I would recommend Citra 3ds Emulator. After downloading an emulator, you then need to boot up the emulator, click "file", click "open ROM", and find your dump in your downloads manager that it brings up. You should then be able to play the training game. Hope this helps, Preston

review.reviewtitle: This worked for people with password problem credit to JustDaniel #4224(discord)
review.reviewbody:
Ok so for people with drastic or whatever u have. Basically you have to download all 13 files by clicking the all 13 button files.(when u scroll the way down to the download section it has that button) Do not download the files individually.
When u click 13 files it will downlaod as a .zip file. That zip file will then be used. You have to take out the DSCP.sav file from the .zip file called mcdonalds-japan-ecdp-rom-training-nintendo-ds-cartridge-dump.zip or smth.
Now copy the DSCP.sav file from the zip (you might need to extract ONLY the dscp.sav file if u cant copy it through the zip, but thar file should still he represent in the zip even after copying it) and now you move it into your backup folder for drastic. That dscp.sav file will be renamed to mcdonalds-japan-ecdp-rom-training-nintendo-ds-cartridge-dump.dsv. (just copy this and rename it)
DO NOT EXTRACT THE MCDONALDS S ZIP AT ALL LEAVE IT AS ZIP
Now the game will work with the password. The zip file doesnt need to be in drastic or anything it can just sit in download or where ever it is. For me the second button worked so u can click that and enter 482500 and it will work and take u to the game.
If u need help my discord is yourmom #7077 or the original person who helped me JustDaniel #4224

Somebody actually reverse engineered the serial key registration. It depends on your DS or DSi's MAC Address. You can also get them from emulators. This made it possible to make a totally new manager account or use the game without the .sav file. Also, if you are using DraStic for Android, your MAC Address will always be 00-01-02-03-04-05.
Here is the link to this persons GitHub page for it. https://github.com/KuromeSan/eCDP-Serial-Code
He/she also developed a website version. https://ecdp.cbps.xyz/
You can find out you MAC Address for your emulator by using a ROM that has access to the WiFi settings. I used Pokemon Black Ver. 2 to access the settings for my MAC Address.
DM me on Discord if you need help. GoodeName#6969
Credit to Silica for this amazing piece of work. https://www.youtube.com/c/SilicaSan
Have anyone on Discord or Reddit put steps debunking how to get access???

review.reviewtitle: WORKING METHOD TO GET THROUGH MENU
review.reviewbody:
1. Once you get to the menu click the first button which means password in Japanese 2. Enter "482500" 3. This should work and take you to the 2nd password screen 4. Enter "482500" Again 5. This should work and take you past the menu screen into the actual game
I am running DeSmuMe which is an emulator for PC/Mac/Linux with a special save file as the original one didn't work.
You can download DeSmuMe here: http://desmume.org/download/
You can download the WORKING save file here: https://mega.nz/folder/I1B2AToL#ua7qseSEqs6I2JICw5-IuQ
Courtesy to xNOLAx for the save file who converted the original save file to a working one
The save file only works with DeSmuMe and RetroArch
To get the Save file into the emulator:
1. Load the game ROM into the emulator 2. Inside the emulator go to File>Insert ROM save file 3. Click the working save file you downloaded 4. The game should now let you access the menu's and enter the password and get into the game
Hope this helps :D
-TR23
IF YOU NEED HELP WITH MY WORKING METHOD YOU CAN CONTACT ME ON DISCORD AT: TR23UnOfFiCiaL#4124

review.reviewtitle: How to play on Drastic for Android + How to enter verification
review.reviewbody:
Thanks so much Nick Robinson for allowing us to play this game and experience this ourselves! I have played for literally hours as I love cooking games! I found many people confused on how to actually play the game, especially on Android. Here is a guide:
Drastic for Android:
Assuming that you already installed Drastic, find the zip for the dump. Temporary, extract it only for the .sav file. Find the Drastic folder and find the folder named 'backups' move the sav into the folder and rename the file extension into .dsv. Now, recompress the game and name the .zip after the nds file. (That would be: DSCDP_CRUJN6_00) Now open Drastic, play the game, and now that you have the .sav (.dsv in this situation) the password included will work.
Entering Verification:
Now that you have the game and save file ready, in the first option of the McDonald's menu, enter '428500'. It will ask again but for the actual serial. The person who used it had the same answer for the name. Type '428500' again. The game should now be up and running! Enjoy being an McDonald's employee for the time you play it. (It will be in Japanese) For the verification to work, once again you must have the .sav file. Anymore questions? Email colress101@gmail.com. I'll try to respond within 24 hours.

I'm not sure if anyone does this but I really enjoy having all my emulated games with custom icons featuring the boxart. Unfortunately, I've yet to see a high-quality scan of this game's boxart, so I've decided to make a mock-up using the existing renders I've found. It's not perfect, but I believe it's good enough to look good. If anyone is interested, I'll share a link for both a .png and .ico file for the mock-up below.
PNG: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d8e4YcU6Vn490uQAqmW81VH4MqWKdwAh/view?usp=sharing Icon: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l6d0FB32vGxn-2-r5MquE3G82i6svfyg/view?usp=sharing
I really hope that Nick or Codi will upload scans of the boxart and manuals for future preservation. Thanks again for dumping the game!

Kinda making this for myself but...
1. Download DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds and DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav
2. Download DeSmuMe (http://desmume.org/download/)
3. Open DeSmuMe in your files
4. Click file and open rom
5.Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds
6.Then let it go to the menu screen
7. Click file again and import backup memory
8. Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav
9.Then let it go to the menu screen again
10.Click the first option
11.Enter "482500" twice
BOOM YOUR IN!

review.reviewtitle: I make this account just to help ya'll (3rd option solution)
review.reviewbody:
If you're running de rom on a ds/dsi/3ds or any Nintendo console all you have to do is look for your MAC address (non pun intended) by going to settings>internet>options>system information, and there you have your MAC address.
Now, go to ecdp.cbps.xyz and type in you MAC address and any ID and password you want to put in remember it must be six digits and full numbers. Click on place offering and there you have it, a useful serial key number.
Now, open the game, click on the third option Type your ID then your password (It should be the same, I used 000000 cause it's easy to remember) At this part the keyboard should be free to use and now you should type your serial key number the 3 times that the game ask you to do it. And Boom, you're in a free to play a game that you don't understand 'cause you don't speak Japanese
You can find me at discord as tinaparati#0833 and @tinaparati on Instagram.

review.reviewtitle: Amazing blend of corporations, culture, and gaming
review.reviewbody:
After watching the documentary, I had to check this out. I- got it up and running and it was well worth it.
-------------------------------------------------------
If you cannot get the ROM to run, there are MANY answers in the reviews on this same page. Want to play it on PC? Here's what "Risuko" (https://archive.org/details/%40risuko) said on this same page:
1. Download DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds and DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav 2. Download DeSmuMe (http://desmume.org/download/) 3. Open DeSmuMe in your files 4. Click file and open rom 5.Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds 6.Then let it go to the menu screen 7. Click file again and import backup memory 8. Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav 9.Then let it go to the menu screen again 10.Click the first option 11.Enter "482500" twice

Wow... This game is really fun. Musics are really great, although it's japanese and i don't understand anything it's still pretty fun. I use google translate sometimes but you know, google is not really good at translating stuff... Also did i said that music in this game is really great?
9/10 (-1 point because it is japanese but it's a lost game so there is nothing to do about it...)

review.reviewtitle: If you don't know how to read comments and instructions, you don't deserve to play this game
review.reviewbody:
I mean, really. Anybody not checking the comments here in order to get it working with DesMuMe don't deserve to play it. Below, there was a comment by user "codyfitzpatrick" highlighting what to do in order to play the game. However, he missed a step. The added step is step #9. With this, you should be able to play the game, barring the potential language barrier.
1. Download DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds and DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav 2. Download DeSmuMe (http://desmume.org/download/) 3. Open DeSmuMe in your files 4. Click file and open rom 5. Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds 6. Then let it go to the menu screen 7. Click file again and import backup memory 8. Click DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav 9. In the "Choose one of the saves sizes" section, choose "MANUAL" and, from the drop down menu "FLASH 4Mbit". 10. Then let it go to the menu screen again 11. Click the first option 12. Enter "482500" twice. (The button at the bottom is the Confirm" button)
There you have it.

Well you can play it on an emulator called DELTA on iPhone and iPad all you need is a third party files manager, a computer,time,patience,and to change the .sav file to a .dsv through your third party file manager add the .dsv file as a save file and done
The computer is to download AltStore through altserver on your computer BUT I must warn you that you need iTunes directly from Apple and an iTunes account to get AltStore on your iPhone or ipad
Enjoy allüòÄ

For Linux, (any distro that can install flatpak), ChromeOS, Raspberry Pi OS, Sulin, A fuckin' mp3 nugget that can use flatpak, first download the .dsv and .sav packages in the downloads section, and then just go to https://flatpak.org/setup/ and follow the instructions. (it's best to use native when you can, so on debian-based, fedora, opensuse, arch linux, and ubuntu-based systems, skip this step (but if ya wanna do it, ya can) and just skip to the end for those specific download instructions. come back here when you're done.
Then, in ya terminal ya ganna wanna run flatpak install flathub org.desmume.DeSmuME then just say yes, and input your password a fuckin billion times. Some versions of flatpak are visual, so just use that instead, but the terminal version will always work. to run it, click the icon (maybe you'll have to close and open it if the environment wasn't set up right) or simply run the command flatpak run org.desmume.DeSmuME (if you're shit at being good at life, remember copy and paste will normally be ctrl+shift+v not ctrl+v.) fuckin dumbass.
so then click on file, open, and then the nds one. Let the menu screen finish, then click on file again, import *something something, i'm to lasy to read past one word*, and your sav file. (someone said it didn't work for them, if it doesn't work for you, just download it at https://mega.nz/folder/I1B2AToL#ua7qseSEqs6I2JICw5-IuQ and I had to rename it as a sav file. The menu screen will load and you're in business.
Last things: for ubuntu and its flavors, sudo apt-get update -y then sudo apt-get install -y desmume OR just sudo apt install desmume and for debian and its flavors (including raspberry pi and chromeOS' linux), sudo apt-get install desmume and for arch linux, sudo pacman -S desmume You're starting to see a trend, but oh no, fedora fucks it all up. sudo dnf install https://download1.rpmfusion.org/free/fedora/rpmfusion-free-release-*FEDORA VERSION*.noarch.rpm -y (the number of the version, not the name) and rpm fusion fedora is obviously just sudo dnf install desmume -y And the disgusting abomination of random kernels thrown together that is openSUS(e), go here https://software.opensuse.org/package/desmume?search_term=desmume and find your personalized package. I will give no further instruction, because openSUSE is gross, as is everyone who uses it.
P.S. I don't know japanese, and I got 8/10 on the challenge mcdonald's on my first try. to summarize, I'M BETTER THAN YOU, BITCH.

review.reviewtitle: Need some help on importing save file date to real DSi hardware.
review.reviewbody:
Hey there! I managed to get this game on REAL hardware, by modding my DSi. I was wondering how to actually get the save file data onto this ROM on my modded DSI. I'm sort of new to this stuff and this "Game" seems really interesting.
My Discord is Silas#8487
Thanks for uploading this master-piece! Silas

Stuck Windows Users:
https://archive.org/compress/mcdonalds-japan-ecdp-rom-training-nintendo-ds-cartridge-dump https://github.com/TASVideos/BizHawk-Prereqs/releases https://ci.appveyor.com/project/zeromus/desmume/build/artifacts
1. Download all three items, 2. Create a new folder, name it as you wish, copy DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds and DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav from the mcdonalds zip, place the DeSmuMe.exe in the same folder 3. Install the Prereqs from github 4. Run DeSmuMe, if you get Windows smart screen, click on More info and run anyway 5. Click on Open ROM... (Ctrl O) select DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.nds 6. Click on the screen so it goes to the main menu 7. Click on File and Import Backup Memory... select DSCDP_CRUJN6_00.sav 8. In the "Choose one of the saves sizes" section, choose "MANUAL" and in the drop down choose "FLASH 4Mbit" 9. Click on the screen so it goes to the main menu 10. Choose the first option, click on the OK on the right side then enter 482500, then the pink Confirm button at the bottom, enter code again

I've followed all steps and working well but when i got to do the final step before entering the password, I select the .SAV file and select manual and on the drop down menu select the FLASH 4Mbit and click ok and I get the error message of " SAVE WAS NOT SUCCESSFULLY IMPORTED "
Anyone know what do to do next!? <3
help me i cant get this on mac

review.reviewtitle: Amazing game, very easy to set up.
review.reviewbody:
McDonald's eCDP Training Game is fantastic. Nick Robinson put the thought into giving the game to public use by dumping the rom. Though I am 7 months late, I LOVE this game.
I have transferred eCDP onto all of my handheld consoles. Original NTR-001 DS, DSi, and the Nintendo 3DS. The game works perfectly on all consoles and it is rather entertaining.
My favorite concept of the game is that you, the player, can understand the fundamentals of running a McDonald's restaurant.
If anybody help on downloading the game on your Nintendo DS, send me a Discord message. I'm willing to help! Shemy#4283 Because of many other bots friend requesting me, join the Nintendo eCDP discord server then add me so I know that you're apart of a mutual server so I can help you out. https://bit.ly/ecdpdiscordserver Official eCDP Discord Server ^^^

review.reviewtitle: such a gem of a rom! (also made a code to bypass password screen)
review.reviewbody:
love this cant believe it exists. i saw the documentary when it came out. i used to make AR codes for the MKDS and well im not to fond of passwords lol. wile it works fine its just cumbersome imo so for you guy that dont want to deal with the saves at all. here you go.
bypass password screen. 920C5E38 00000003 220C5E38 00000007 D2000000 00000000
code work with emulators and flash cards that has ar support. when active click the first button that normally takes you to the password screen.
the code is a check sum set to when the password screen becomes active the code simply skips to the main menu.
short sweet and to the point. ive made sure it work fine. enjoy!

review.reviewbody: It works on a 3ds with twilight!! its such a fun little game, thank you so much for sharing it! just needed to drag and drop the .nds in roms/nds, run the game once, exit and use ftp to drag and drop the .sav in roms/nds/saves, open the game and input the passcode and boom it works perfectly. at least now i'd be somewhat prepared if ever life takes a turn and i suddenly end up a mcdonalds worker hahaha!

review.reviewtitle: How to play on a phone!
review.reviewbody:
You will need to have Retroarch or some other emulator installed along with a core to run the file. I'm using melonDS. In your browser, tap the 'Desktop Site' switch and go to 'Show All' on the webpage. You will need to download the .nds file and the .sav file to load into the emulator. The .nds file may take some time to download. Load the files into the emulator and play using the first option on the menu. Type 482500 and then 482500. You should now be playing the game!
I also really enjoy playing, thanks so much for uploading this!
go to here if u don't have a save file and want to setup a password and ID : https://github.com/KuromeSan/eCDP-Serial-Code/releases

To play the game, you need to have a good understanding of Japanese or (What I used) Google Lens. I played on my 3DS XL using Twilight Menu ++ (nds-bootstrap) downloaded straight from Universal Updater (Running the latest version of Luma 3DS). Works well, no bugs. If you wanna play the game via nds-Twilight menu ++, place the nds file in a folder, then the sav file in a folder named "saves" (In the same folder where you placed the nds file). Then have fun I guess. Anyway, it's a neat game, and a great piece of DS history
